member.name: IEnumMoniker.Clone

summary.para: Creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current one.

This method makes it possible to record a particular point in the enumeration sequence and then return to that point at a later time. The caller must release this new enumerator separately from the first enumerator.

member.param: Address of an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the enumeration object. If the method is unsuccessful, the value of this output variable is undefined.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Insufficient memory available for this operation.

member.name: IEnumMoniker.Next
member.summary: Retrieves the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of items to be retrieved. If there are fewer than the requested number of items left in the sequence, this method retrieves the remaining elements.

param.name: rgelt
param.para: The enumerator is responsible for calling , and the caller is responsible for calling through each pointer enumerated. If celt is greater than 1, the caller must also pass a non-NULL pointer passed to pceltFetched to know how many pointers to release.

member.param: The number of items that were retrieved. This parameter is always less than or equal to the number of items requested. This parameter can be NULL if celt is 1.
member.returns: If the method retrieves the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

member.name: IEnumMoniker.Reset
member.summary: Resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: IEnumMoniker.Skip
member.summary: Skips over the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of items to be skipped.
member.returns: If the method skips the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

member.name: IEnumMoniker
member.summary: Enumerates the components of a moniker or the monikers in a table of monikers.
